But just two days after Luis Enrique and his squad landed back in Madrid following their frustrations in the desert, the coach was handed his marching orders by Spanish FA chiefs.

reused_details.reused: The Spanish soccer federation thanked Luis Enrique, but said it was time to 'start a new project' to keep the growth achieved by the coach in recent years.
reused_by_aic: In a statement issued by Madrid bosses, they said: 'The sports management of the RFEF (Spanish FA) has transferred to the president a report in which it is determined that a new project should start for the Spanish Soccer Team.

reused_details.reused: Other candidates who had been considered besides De la Fuente, who was Spain's under-21 coach, included former Belgium manager Roberto Mart'nez and former Athletic Bilbao coach Marcelino Garc'a Toral.
reused_by_aic: His successor has been named as current under-21 coach Luis de la Fuente, who has been in charge of development and youth teams since 2013 and who won both the European under-19 and under-21 titles in that period.

reused_details.reused: Luis Enrique took over the national team in 2018 to start revamping the squad after its elimination in the round of 16 of the World Cup in Russia.
reused_by_aic: 'The Asturian coach managed to give a new impetus to the national team since his arrival, in 2018, through a profound renovation that has consolidated a generational change in the team and in Spanish football.' reused_details.reused: The 61-year-old De la Fuente, a former left back with Sevilla and Athletic Bilbao, helped Spain's under-19 squad win the European Championship in 2015, and the under-21 team win Euro 2019.
reused_by_aic: His successor has been named as current under-21 coach Luis de la Fuente, who has been in charge of development and youth teams since 2013 and who won both the European under-19 and under-21 titles in that period.

reused_details.reused: Other candidates who had been considered besides De la Fuente, who was Spain's under-21 coach, included former Belgium manager Roberto Mart'nez and former Athletic Bilbao coach Marcelino Garc'a Toral.
reused_by_aic: His successor has been named as current under-21 coach Luis de la Fuente, who has been in charge of development and youth teams since 2013 and who won both the European under-19 and under-21 titles in that period.

reused_details.reused: Luis Enrique took over the national team in 2018 to start revamping the squad after its elimination in the round of 16 of the World Cup in Russia.
reused_by_aic: 'The Asturian coach managed to give a new impetus to the national team since his arrival, in 2018, through a profound renovation that has consolidated a generational change in the team and in Spanish football.' That generational change - with the retirements of the remaining members of the squad that dominated European and world football from 2008 to 2012 - was not enough to save Enrique.

reused_details.reused: Spain's loss to Morocco was their third straight tournament exit on penalties, having also suffered defeat by that method against hosts Russia in the 2018 World Cup last 16.
reused_by_aic: Spain have now gone out of their last three tournaments on penalties, losing to Russia in 2018 and Italy in the Euro 2020 semi-finals with criticism that Enrique's teams controlled possession but lacked a cutting edge.

reused_details.reused: According to a statement from the Royal Spanish Football Federation, "Both the president, Luis Rubiales, and the sporting director, Jose Francisco Molina, have informed the coach of their decision."
reused_by_aic: 'Both the president, Luis Rubiales, and the sports director, Jose Francisco Molina, have transmitted the decision to the coach.

reused_details.reused: "The sports management of the RFEF has transferred to the president a report in which it is determined that a new project should start for the Spanish soccer team.
reused_by_aic: In a statement issued by Madrid bosses, they said: 'The sports management of the RFEF (Spanish FA) has transferred to the president a report in which it is determined that a new project should start for the Spanish Soccer Team.

reused_details.reused: "The aim is to continue with the growth achieved in recent years thanks to the work carried out by Luis Enrique and their collaborators."
reused_by_aic: 'The aim is continuing with the growth achieved in recent years thanks to the work carried out by Luis Enrique and their collaborators.

reused_details.reused: The Spanish FA has announced that Luis Enrique would be replaced by Jose Luis de la Fuente as Spain's coach.
reused_by_aic: But just two days after Luis Enrique and his squad landed back in Madrid following their frustrations in the desert, the coach was handed his marching orders by Spanish FA chiefs.

His successor has been named as current under-21 coach Luis de la Fuente, who has been in charge of development and youth teams since 2013 and who won both the European under-19 and under-21 titles in that period.
